name: Pineapple Buckwheat Pancakes with Coconut Cream
description: These pineapple buckwheat pancakes with coconut cream are super yummy and so fluffy. And they're so much healthier than regular pancakes!
recipeIngredient: 1 cup buckwheat flour (either grind raw buckwheat groats or use store-bought flour)
1 cup pineapple, peeled and chopped into small pieces
1 can full-fat coconut milk or cream, refrigerated overnight
1/2 cup pineapple, peeled and chopped into small pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Grind the flax seeds in a food processor. Whisk them toghether with 2 tablespoons of water and set aside to thicken. Meanwhile make the batter: Combine the remaining pancake ingredients in a medium bowl and stir constinuously until smooth. Add the flax seeds and stir in.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly grease a skillet and heat over medium heat. Add a ladleful of the batter. Cook for about 2 minutes or until golden. You know it's time to flip them over when little bubbles appear on the surface. Put them in the oven to keep them warm.

recipeInstructions.text: Next, make the coconut cream: Carefully open the can of refrigerated coconut milk or cream. Make sure to keep it level so the cream and liquid keeps separate. Put a mixing bowl in the freezer for about 5 minutes. Then scoop out the cream. Stop scooping when you reach the liquid (you can use it for smoothies). Beat for about a minute using a mixer (on high speed), then add agave and vanilla and continue for another 2 minutes until it becomes creamy.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a small pan and add the peach and pineapple pieces together with the agave. Cook for about 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the pancakes with the coconut cream and the cooked fruits.  Sprinkle with coconut flakes.
